meanings.definition: Capable of being extended or protruded
meanings.sent1: The telescope had a protractile feature that allowed it to extend for better viewing.
meanings.sent2: The cat's claws are protractile, meaning they can be extended for hunting.
meanings.sent3: The protractile ruler decided to stretch itself out just for fun.
meanings.sent4: Her patience was like a protractile rubber band, always able to be stretched a little further.
meanings.sent5: The superhero's protractile arms could reach any villain trying to escape.

meanings.definition: Able to be drawn out or prolonged
meanings.sent1: The protractile meeting seemed to go on forever, with no end in sight.
meanings.sent2: The protractile negotiations between the two countries finally reached a resolution.
meanings.sent3: The protractile story in the book had the readers eagerly turning each page.
meanings.sent4: His protractile excuses for being late were starting to wear thin.
meanings.sent5: The protractile winter seemed to drag on endlessly, with no sign of spring.
